Reviews.Title: “BELIEVE ME AND NEVER STAY THERE!”
Reviews.Author: juliana b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old and not clean at all... very disgusting place... bathroom dirty and smells!!! the staff you can't find.... no room service... stairs everywhere.. carpet very old and dirty... I'll never stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rnew06
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the only upside to this hotel is its location but that's the only good thing I can say. There is no one Manning the front desk so if you need anything you must leave the hotel and go around the corner to the best Western and talk to their front desk clerk. The condition of the rooms in the hotel is deplorable. There was mold in the bathroom and the bed room walls. Large chunks of paint were falling off the celling, molding was broken off the walls and left on the floor, bathroom door would not close, about 3 minutes of hot water for a shower, and I could go on and on. I tried to get my room changed they said no, I tried to check out early and they said I would loose my money, I asked them to fix the bathroom door they said they would see what they could do....which was tell me anything to shut me up but do nothing. I am not one to complain about many things but if you stay here you will regret it so consider this a warning from a fellow traveler....STAY AWAY !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Frankm2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps from Piazza San Marco! close to vaporetto and water taxi stops. We had to find our own room on arriving, which was a bit confusing, because the main desk is actually at San Marco Best Western, (around the corner, not far really) and the check in staff had to run back and forth with guest keys. We finally found our room, which was on the 5th floor, and were delighted to find that there was a separate bedroom for our 13 year old. The bathroom was modern, and very clean. The main bedroom was a rather large room(surprising) with a tiny terrace. Not much of a view, but plenty of light. The only real disappointment was the air conditioning, which barely cooled the room. We've stayed in a couple hotels so far on this trip, and have found the air conditioning pretty lacking in all of them. Maybe this is just the way of the Italians, but..... The breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Never forever”
Reviews.Author: hkhuseini
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was no one waiting for us and we had to drag our bags from one place to another for a distance of about two kilometers. Reception staff where at the other hotel next door were too agressive to the guests.They were all arrogant in their dealings with guests to the maximum degree especially with guests from middle east

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers for 4 days and not remedied despite pronmises.”
Reviews.Author: waghorn
Reviews.Content: Very small and a bad damp smell throughout the hotel. Our room was very cold and despite a heater in the room it never warmed up to a comfortable temperature. Also non existent hot water. Every request to reception was met with a promise it would be seen to. It never was. On the third night we were changed rooms to one that was at least warm but still no hot water for a show. Also it turned out we were locked into the booking. We decided to move onto Rome and asked when we arrived but told we had to stay there for 4 days we had mistakenly booked for. There was no flexibilty in the booking. This coloured our view of Venice as we had to be there when we felt we had experienced it completely as we could. Attitude of hotel staff was less than helpful, even arrogant at times just repeating things like a mantra rather than communicating about an issue. I'm sure there are better options. Helpful and accomadating staff make all the difference. Lastly no tea and coffee making facilties so no early morning cuppa in bed if you enjoly that. Nothing open to buy one either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but what is that smell?”
Reviews.Author: SFOTraveler1113
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right behind Piazza San Marco in the heart of the tourist section of Venice. Getting there: Just take the water taxi from the train station to Piazza San Marco and thenstanding in the middle of Piazza San Marco facing away from the water walk straight back and find Calle dei- Fabbri. The hotel is right next to a Best Western and you will find that the Best Western right next door is where to go for check in and questions. The day I arrived, the tide was very high and the square was partially flooded. Apparently, the hotel also experienced about a foot of water entering as well. However, all of the rooms are at least one floor up so this did not pose a problem. The room was very spacious. Huge, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, good selection of TV channels. However, there was a smell of sewage in the room. I thought it may be due to the flooding but upon speaking to other guests and seeing one of their rooms, it became apparent that it was just my room. It was late and I was leaving the next day so I just slept, woke up early and checked my bag while I went sight seeing. All in all a great room, great location, great price but the smell hopefully was just a freak occurrence and not something that anyone else experienced.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE ...BE AWARE”
Reviews.Author: labelle58
Reviews.Content: BED BUGS This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. The rooms were small and we had bed bugs. We were Itching and scratching. We asked the clerk at the recpetion to change us , but they said that if we wanted a better room we had to pay more. We then asked to speak to the Hotel manager, no service , rude and extremely arrogant. We stayed there 2 nights and then left.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience! Wish I could give zero stars.”
Reviews.Author: newlywed072
Reviews.Content: WARNING! If you book this hotel using Orbtiz, the Hotel may, on your arrival, move you to a different, dumpy hotel in a bad location. If I could have given zero stars to this hotel I would have. I have to say, this was one of the worst experiences Iâ€™ve had with a hotel. We arrived at the Ambassador Tre Rose Hotel in Venice on a Friday afternoon and were really pleased with its location and couldnâ€™t wait to drop our bags in our room and get out and explore Venice. We went to check in and at first they couldnâ€™t find our reservation. After a couple of minutes, a worker at the hotel who was behind the reception counter (working behind a curtain) came out and told us that our room had water problems and that we had to be moved to another hotel room. We said OK and he proceeded to take us out of the hotel and take us on a 10 minute walk to another hotel. We had to walk through a dark alley (it had a cement ceiling on it so no light was shining in it) that had feces in it. We then ended up taking a right out of that alley and going up another alley that was desolate and a dead end. Our hotel was on that part of the alley. The room was big, but it was a dump. Right away we objected to the room and wanted to be put in another hotel. The person from the Ambassador said we could write a letter and have our money refunded, but there was nothing he could do about the room. My new wife and I (we were on our honeymoon), discussed the issue and decided to go talk to the manager at the Ambassador. Along the way, we stopped at other hotels checking to see if they had any water problems and if they had any availability. None of the hotels said they had water problems. We went back and met with the manager and explained to him that we were not happy with the other hotel, how we paid $255 for the night to be in San Marco square and on a street with a lot of life and shops, and how we did not want to be walking through unsafe alleys that have feces in them. The manager took me outside to show me an alley behind the Ambassador (which was more like a courtyard) and explained to me that some people donâ€™t feel safe in that alley. The alley was well lit and he pointed out that they had three security cameras monitoring it. I wasnâ€™t sure why he was showing me this, so I asked him if the alley we would have to walk to for the new hotel had security cameras in it, he said no. So instead of making me feel better, he made me feel even worse about the new hotel. We then asked him to show us the water damaged room and he refused. He said if I were injured in the damaged room he would go to jail (according to Italian law) and he was not about to go to jail. He did show us an economy room and even that was much nicer than the hotel we were put in. The funny thing about showing us the economy room was that we didnâ€™t book an economy room, we booked a classic. He couldnâ€™t even get the type of room we were in right. Since we were in a classic room and not the economy room that had water damage, why were we bumped? After seeing another post on this site saying they couldnâ€™t get their room because of plumbing problems it is pretty clear that they just overbooked the hotel and that is why we were bumped. The more we talked to him about the situation, the less helpful he became. Instead of coming up with other options for us, he just kept sighting Italian law stating that he was only legally obligated to put us in another 3 star hotel. At one point he told us we could sleep in the lobby if the other hotel was not going to be good enough for us. That was pretty insulting. He continued the insults by constantly looking at me and indicating to me to control my wife. My wife was never out of control or angry, she was just trying to make her point be heard and he kept cutting her off by saying the same things over and over. Amongst the insults, he managed to tip his cap about customers that use Orbtiz to book rooms in his hotel. He informed us that since we only booked the room for one night and that we booked through Orbitz at a cheaper rate, we were bumped to another hotel. Other guests had paid more for their rooms so it seems that you are taking your chances if you book this hotel through Orbitz. After about a half an hour of this, he finally told us we could have a refund if we werenâ€™t happy with the new room. We would just have to write a letter to Orbitz. If we did that, he would grant us a refund. When we got home and contacted Orbitz he declined the refund sighting Italian law saying all he needed to do was put us in another 3 star hotel. We knew this manager was sketchy, but we took it on faith that he would live up to what he said. Sadly he really showed us the type of business that he runs and the type of person that he is. I would strongly discourage anyone from booking a room in this hotel. The Best Western across the street has much nicer people working there.

Reviews.Title: “Room in the middle of Everything in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Phreddiva
Reviews.Content: Take a water bus to St. Marco, and you're right there. Passing through postcard stands and piles of tours to get to your room... the room might be cramped, and crowded, and you might be able to hear every single thing that happens in the street below... and that's ok. Because, after you take your shower (trying to not get water all over the toilet paper and toilet because the shower is practically on top of the toilet) and freshen up, you'll be immersed in Venice. Venice, with music pouring from every crevice and with gelato and delicious sandwiches. Don't come here if you want quiet. But why are you in Venice if you want quiet?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: giovac1torrente
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is awesme it worth every penny .the locatrion made possible for us to enjoy Venice .Thr rooms were ok and very clean .The towel were changed every day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GracieOffaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for seeing the sights but also for navigating from the boat. Easy to find when you get off the vaparetto. We did not opt for breakfast as it was recommended from other reviewers. Lots of little cafe's nearby and not too close to bars / restaurants that would keep you awake at night. The bathroom was tiny and the shower was almost over the toilet but it was perfect for what we needed. We were out of the room at 10am and not back from dinner in evenings until 11-12pm.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Penny”
Reviews.Author: ImanTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel made it possible for us to enjoy Venice better. We arrived late, but because we informed the hotel in advance, they waited for us and reserved the best room for us. The rooms were spacious and very clean and modern- with a little bidet as as well. Towels are changed every day. Very quiet even in the middle of the day, even though we were just a stones throw away from St. Marks Square, Breakfast was excellent. Plenty of choices and being a Muslim, we were fine. The staff allowed us to check out untill 1pm!. There is a nice take away & Ice cream parlour just 2 mins away and they open till 11pm. Since we splurge on the hotel, we did not have so much to spen on meals. and we know venice to be very expensive. We were lucky that this hotel is also very near a Halal kebab shop. the only one in Venice. It was inly Â£3 per meal! We will definitely go back to this hotel for its location and value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Got what we paid for but could do better”
Reviews.Author: g-leinster
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on a quiet side street just of the main square, the hotel is in a great location to use as a base for sightseeing. Slighly outbated but not a horror story Location Couldnt be better Rooms Very small but fine if you dont plan on spending too much time in the room. No view but it annoys me when people expect a great few from a city centre hotel room Service No major problems, multilingual staff, ordered a double bed but arrived late to be allocated a twin, quickly rectifed the next day Facilities Small reception room in the lobby and an adjoining restaurant shared as a breakfast room with their sister hotel Overall Great location, not awful but shop around and could probably do better

Reviews.Title: “Twin room compact, a little dated but clean, very central to St Mark's Sq!”
Reviews.Author: LoveHolidaysNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We had no major complaints, it was very close to St Mark's Square, not too noisy and felt secure. The room was a little old fashioned, but very clean, fresh towels everyday! And a perfectly clean en suite shower room.The breakfast included was served in the nearby hotel in the same chain (Best Western). The restaurant was clean, and a limited variety of food on offer: cereal, hot and cold drinks, croissants, tinned fruit, cake, selection of cold meats..... (no cooked breakfasts) the only let down was the restaurant pictured on the hotel's website is nothing like the one we dined at, it must be from another hotel in the chain! It very much lacked the grandeur we were looking forward to! But as i say, the food was fine, and the environment was clean! Just don't expect more than what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll & Hyde”
Reviews.Author: fillyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start of a week in Italy and having read some of the reviews here I was really ready to right a glowiing report in it's defence. The location is inarguably fantastic. Our room was large, and the bathroom - unlike some of the reviewers - was clean and more than adequate in size with both a shower and bath. The service was profesional and efficient. Our only complaint was the breakfast is distintly average, and we'd recommend the little cafe next door instead for great cappuccino. Then, having been up to the mountains for a few days, we returned for our last couple of nights in Venice. This time the room was smaller but OK in size, and had a balcony. The bathroom was smaller, but still adequate in size for city centre. However, the bathroom was really outdated and the ceiling had a generous covering of mould! To be honest it didn't look like anything that a decent clean, treatment and paint job wouldn't fix, and it seems a real shame that they let themselves and their customers down like this. In short - it's a bit of a lottery, you may get a great room for the location and price, or you may get their next "project" that hasn't been tackled yet!

Reviews.Title: “Antiquated and over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Cainthecity
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I stayed in 3 stat hotels in Venice, Naples and Rome in my trip and this hotel stood out as the worst. I think they made up their own rating. The only positive thing I can say is that the location was excellent. The room smelled so bad (like what I couldn't say) that even with the window open and air freshner for two days it persisted. They finally offered to change my room but that one stunk too. The breakfast was disgusting. Stale rolls and old fruit. Delish. They didn't even have espresso which is standard fare in Europe. It's so noisy u should stay out there is no point in sleeping. I live in NYC and have no problem sleeping at home but there isn't a loading dock behind my house, they start around 7 am, meanwhile the walls are so thin I can hear the Japanese tourists on one side and the toilet flushing in the room on the other. Net net: stay at your own risk

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Taunte
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 days at this hotel.The location was very good,near everything.We found the staff to be extremely helpful ,warm and friendly.The breakfast was very good,with a lot of variety,even eggs,which are hard to find at most hotels in Italy,and right next door in a pretty restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location clean but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: chipman75
Reviews.Content: We have just turned from Venice with my wife and has stayed at this hotel.It is really a few steps away from San Marco square and in the middle of high fashion brand stores,like Gucci,Valentino,Armani... We stayed 3 nights.The reception was so kind that in order to make favour,they upgrade our room from standart to superior room.As we entered the room,we were shocked because when we checked their room pictures from net,They look like 70 meter square but they are really very very small.like 20 meter square.As cleanliness,it was really perfect since everyday the service clean the room and change all the bed sheets. After the first night,we used to live in this room and it seemed sweet and comfortable.As a usefull info: Please do not forget to take something with you to be prevented against moschitos.since everywhere is water,there are lots of moschitos everywhere even in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location :-)”
Reviews.Author: sueCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our Honeymoon (4 nights) in Ambassador Tre Rose. We absolutely loved the place. The location could not have been any better, the service was warm and welcoming, the room was not extravagant, but a nice size and clean. We even had a little balcony where we could enjoy the wonderful and surprisingly warm nights. The location is excellent and very central, and of course there is a little noice from the people in the street. But don't worry, it seems all of Venice closes down at 10 at night, so you will get your sleep anyway :-). All in all we really enjoyed our stay, and can certainly recommend Ambassador Tre Rose. If it is your first time in Venice the location is perfect - you will always be able to find your way home ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NavyLark
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice for a 3 night city visit and stayed at the Ambassador Tre Rose. We were impresssed. The hotel is ideally placed just behind the Piazza San Marco [the heart of the city]. It is a typical small, old style, big city European hotel. Although the rooms are very small they are very clean, well decorated and the ensuite shower/toilet facility is well appointed. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned each day with changes of good quality towels and linen. Continental breakfast was served in a sister hotel just across the the street (20metres distant). There was a good, varied choice of food and beverages.Fresh fruit was available. Surrounded by good value restaurants this hotel is ideal for a short sight-seeing visit. Be prepared for an expensive visit though, Venice is an expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “Tre rose Tre Stars !!”
Reviews.Author: Dasch
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at Tre Rose, I was initially disappointed. The Way it is presented,the locality, the decor was indifferent. When we were first shown to the room,I looked at my wife,she looked at me and we knew we had to move. The staff happily moved us,but it took for us to ask for a different Hotel,that they gave us a Private suite at the top of the 4th Floor. I think I am in a good position to review The Tre Rose as I have seen their worst & best rooms. Dont get me wrong,their worst isnt awfull, just....uninspired. This is Venice after all! It was clean,tidy,nice bed. It was however small,and dated. The Private suite was much bigger,felt much more luxurious,but still a bit on the dated side.But very clean and very quiet. Big pluses for the Tre Rose were the staff,who exceded themselves,to make sure we were happy,especially the half Italian/half Brit receptionist! Breakfasts were all you could eat and pretty good. We left satisfied with the Hotel,but Blown away by Venice.This is a must see location. As a footnote,From the waterbus head for St Marks Square,cross the square and take the 3rd right before the end,you will be almost opposite the Hotel. Enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel for City Break”
Reviews.Author: Nikki3055
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, as were the rooms and staff were very friendly. Ideally situated just behind St Marks Square - easy to find. No cooked breakfasts, however, plenty of choice for cereals and pastries. Would definately stay in this hotel again for a city break. Discovered the Winter months are a good time to visit, as not many queues for tourists attractions and easy access on public transport. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and looking forward to our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PinarS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got great location. We have booked through Lastminute com for 3 nights for Â£280. So price wasn't to bad at all. We wanted to stay in Venice and walk so this hotel was great. It is not luxury but clean, air conditioned worked really well. Very friendly staff. Breakfast is standard and overall I think it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: elgray
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing renovations while we were there, and we got one of the freshly done rooms. Small, but no smaller than most European three-star hotels, with a better-than-usual bathroom. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, and closing windows shut out any street noise at night. (Can't speak, though, for the air conditioning, since we were there in April.) Morning breakfast buffet was downright lavish and the staff friendly and helpful. The location's perfect for anyone who wants to be in San Marco (hint: to avoid walking around the square for hours, looking for the right direction, ask the hotel to describe which portico to take out of the square -- it's behind one of the cafes -- and you'll have at most a two-minute walk from there, over one small bridge). You'll find better, less touristy restaurants, though, in outlying districts. I'd frankly worried after my husband booked it for my birthday trip without checking any reviews, especially after I saw some of the comments here, but things seem to be looking up at the Ambassador Tre Rose. We had a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: Aneeta
Reviews.Content: Great position as this hotel is a stones throw from St Marks square. Hotel is very basic with the tiniest room I have ever been in. Bathroom so small that the sink wouldn't fit and was in the bedroom. As you leave the hotel there is a very nice bar to the right but beware if you eat or drink there you will be seriously ripped off. It is very very very expensive. Having said all that Venice is stunning and we enjoyed our three days there.

Reviews.Title: “indifferent”
Reviews.Author: c.m.hughes
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location (unless you have small children and don't care to explain the exhibits in the wndows of the erotica museum across the alley) Dull old fashioned decor and cramped. Smelt of drains in the foyer and stairwell. Beds were comfortable, though pillows were on the hard side. Bedroom was beautifully tidied each day and the girl in the restaurant was very obliging. Continental brekfast was decent. The worst thing was the lack of hot water. In five days we managed two hot showers between the two of us. Complaints met with indifference and no offer of a solution. We thought to ask for this to be reflected in the tariff, but after listening for 20mins to some other guests wanting that too, but giving up due to the total immovability of the staff, we decided to pay in total and enjoy the rest of our last day. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Susannadanna
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a disappointment. The carpeting was stained, the room was cramped, but worst of all the balcony doors in your room were always open to the outdoors because the air conditioner unit's hose went through the doors to some connection outside! I've never seen anything like it! We were told all the rooms had the same setup so no help there, and it just didn't feel secure having your room open to the outdoors 24/7. The location was great, but I really couldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Not bad”
Reviews.Author: uribes
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Priceline and then I started reading the reviews. I was really worried because there was no getting out of the deal. Once I got there I was relieved because it is really not as bad as it has been rated. It's not the greatest either but it is ok... I saw worse in Venice. Let me tell you that the location could not be any better. It is VERY close to San Macos Square which is great. The decoration is ok and the only thing that bothered me was the carpet because it had some spots were it is completely worn out. Our bathroom was remodeled and looked great but I did see that in some other rooms it had black (or really dark) tile.. If you get to go to this hotel ask for a room that has been remodelled. We were lucky because we just got it without asking. The hotel was clean and confortable. It is rated as a 4star -- I would rate it as a 3 or 2.5 star level. We paid us$150 which for venice is not bad. Although I was in better bed and breakfasts thru Italy for much lower price. Breakfast was really good, all kinds of stuff Loved this part! I also loved the idea of being close to everything (gondolas, st marcos square, vaporetto stop)..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location very close to Venice San Marco square. The rooms were furnished with tired old furniture and that bathroom hasn't seen a revamping for about 20 years judging by the out of fashion tiles but the price was fair, about 90 euros per night over the Easter weekend. The breakfast was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the same hotel?!”
Reviews.Author: BirdmanShropshire
Reviews.Content: Was I staying in the same hotel as the previous reviewers? Perhaps not because my romantic autumnal trip to Venice could not have had a nicer base! The room was by no means spacious but it was clean and comfortable with tv and AC. The bathroom was of good size with a wonderful rooftop view from the shower. The staff were friendly and helpful but possibly that is because I treated them with respect (it always works wonders, I find!). The only grumble was the breakfast which wasn't wonderful but with all the cafes in venice that wasn't really a problem. So if you want a small, friendly hotel right at the hub of Venice I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny & uncomfortable. Dirty. There were about a dozen dead cockroaches on the floor in the breakfast room. We would never stay in this hotel or recommend it to anyone else.

HotelInfo.Name: Ambassador Tre Rose
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza San Marco-Calle dei Fabbri 905, 30124 Venice, Italy
